verses.roman:
"ye kahe--'kṛṣṇera vaibhava muñi saba jānoṅ'
se jānuka,--kāya-mane muñi ei mānoṅ

synonyms: ye kahe—if anyone says; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; vaibhava—opulences; muñi—I; saba—all; jānoṅ—know; se jānuka—let him know; kāya-mane—by my body and mind; muñi—myself; ei—this; mānoṅ—accept.
translation: "Lord Brahmā said, 'If someone says that he knows everything about Kṛṣṇa's opulence, let him think that way. However, as far as I am concerned, with my body and mind I consider it in this way.
